oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mechanical properties of squeeze cast extruded Al/SiCp composite
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: JOSHI, SS
RAMAKRISHNAN, N
RAMAKRISHNAN, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: matrix
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Al/SiCp/10/20/30%vol composites fabricated by liquid metallurgy route followed by extrusion were tested in tension, shear and compression in the solutionised condition. Their properties were evaluated as a function of volume of reinforcement in the composite and test conditions for understanding their behaviour in the elastic and plastic region. It was evident that the presence of reinforcement makes composites stronger in the elastic region and weaker in the plastic region.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Symposium on Physical Properties of Composites at the 125th TMS Annual Meeting and Exhibition,ANAHEIM, CA,FEB 04-08, 1996
